column4: i have an ssh terminal open, and its behaving strangly, I get no characters appearing on screen when typing anymore, apart from when I hit enter, and it prints " >" (space forwardarrow) how could this happen?
I entered a find command just before it messed up
superq: a mere re-login fixed it, but I was curious as to what could cause it
and I cannot type "reset" as no character keys respond
ahh I see :)
I try entering reset, and hitting enter on the dodgy terminal, it doesnt cause any changes
ctrl-q and reset dont seem to have any effect
just hit ctrl-c
from a text terminal?
yes, SSH login
oh.. ssh login is different
you have to ctrl-c
and re-try your ssh command
reset
will reset the terminal emulation
an explanation would require a long long history lesson about vt100
basically, the echoing of your typing can be turned on and off (so you can enter passwords)
reset will fix most terminal wackyness
try hitting ctrl-q first
hrm.. they should
oh.. sorry.. >
> is an indication of bash continuation
so you can type things like:
ctrl-c tells bash to abort command input
